titleproper.value: Guide to the Irish Repertory Theatre Records

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on  .

change.item: Updated by Megan O'Shea to reflect return of deaccessioned material to donor

p.value:
Donated by Ciarán O'Reilly in June 2016. The accession number associated with this gift is
        2016.055.

abstract.value:
The Irish Repertory Theatre (IRT) was
        founded in New York, New York in 1988 by Charlotte Moore and Ciarán O'Reilly. The IRT
        produces Irish and Irish-American plays and musicals year-round. The Irish Repertory Theatre
        Records document 28 seasons of productions, from 1988 to 2016. Productions include  ,  , and  . The
        records contain press and marketing materials, correspondence, scripts, legal documents,
        financial documents, original artwork, video recordings, and posters. The material consists
        of paper, born-digital, and audiovisual material.

physloc.value:
Materials are stored offsite and advance
        notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business
        days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

p.value:
This series documents 28 seasons of the Irish Repertory Theatre's productions and
            annual benefits, from 1989 to 2016. Material in this series consists of paper,
            born-digital, and audiovisual formats and includes promotional material, photographs,
            artwork, and material pertaining to legal and creative issues from early productions.
            The promotional material includes programs, postcards, posters, and press releases for
            individual productions; tickets, invitations, and programs for annual benefits; and
            issues of  , the IRT's newsletter. The audiovisual
            material consists of video and digital audio and video recordings of select productions,
            including  ,  ,  ,
            and annual benefits. Most productions are well documented through digital and print
            photographs and slides. Artwork includes drawings for set designs and posters.

This series is arranged in chronological order by season, with no arrangement within
            each season.
This subseries includes scripts chosen as part of the  .

This subseries is arranged in chronological order by year and month in which the
              plays were performed by the IRT.

unittitle.value: Subseries II. B. Rejected Script Files

p.value:
This subseries consists of script files submitted for the  that were rejected by the IRT. The files include
              scripts, cover letters, curricula vitae, correspondence with authors, and reader
              reports.

The files in this subseries are loosely arranged in numerical order according to
              numbers assigned to each script as it was received by the Literary Department.

This series documents the work of the Literary Department in evaluating submitted
            scripts and choosing works for the 
            . Material in this series consists entirely of paper.

This series is arranged in two subseries, Subseries II. A. Selected Plays and Subseries
            II.B. Rejected Script Files.

unittitle.value: Local 802, Associated Musicians of Greater New York
New York City Department of Cultural Affairs
Subseries III. A. General Administrative Records

p.value:
This subseries documents the IRT's cooperation with labor unions representing
              performers in New York City and the work of the IRT's Board of Directors. This
              subseries includes correspondence and contracts. Labor unions include the Actors'
              Equity Association, the United Scenic Artists, Local 802 Associated Musicians of
              Greater New York, and the Stage Directors and Choreographers Society. Material
              documenting the work of the Board includes correspondence and meeting agenda and
              minutes.
This subseries is arranged alphabetically by format or topic.

unittitle.value: Subseries III. B. Producing Director Records

p.value:
This subseries documents the work of Ciarán O'Reilly, co-founder and Producing
              Director of the IRT. Materials consists of paper and born-digital material and
              includes correspondence, budgets, notes, box office reports, and scripts.
              Correspondence includes negotiations with the Actors' Equity Association, requests for
              and acknowledgements of financial support for productions and the IRT, and licensing
              for scripts. This subseries contains material regarding the production of  , a production adapted from Sean
              O'Casey's autobiographies, directed by Harold Prince. This subseries also includes
              letters from O'Reilly to IRT members and sponsors, labor unions, and directors of
              productions at the IRT, including Tony Walton and Frank McCourt.

This subseries is arranged alphabetically by production title, topic, or format of
              material.

unittitle.value: Subseries III. C. General Manager Records

p.value:
This subseries documents the work of two of the General Managers of the IRT, Shelley
              A. Troupe and Meridith Sommers. Responsibilities of this role documented in this
              subseries include managing day-to-day activities of the IRT, organizing the IRT's
              annual benefit, participating in advertising and development campaigns, managing the
              box office, and tracking compliance with the Actor's Equity Association (AEA)
              contracts. Material in this subseries consists of paper and born-digital material and
              includes correspondence, budgets, audits, contracts, photographs, box office reports,
              meeting agenda and minutes, and promotional material. This subseries includes Board of
              Directors meeting agenda and minutes and correspondence with the AEA, IRT members and
              sponsors, vendors, and insurance providers.

This subseries is arranged alphabetically by production title, topic, format, or by
              the name of file's creator.

This subseries documents the work of two of Membership Managers of the IRT, Heather
              Kray and Eric Scott. Responsibilities of this role documented in this subseries
              include maintaining relationships with current theatre members as well as with
              advertisers. This subseries consists entirely of born-digital material and includes
              correspondence, spreadsheets, and promotional material.
This subseries is arranged alphabetically by topic.

This subseries documents the work of the Marketing Department, including branding,
              promotion of the IRT and its productions, development of the capital campaign to
              renovate the theatre from 2014 to 2016, and the creation of a new website in 2012. The
              material in this subseries consists of paper and born-digital material and includes
              correspondence, promotional material, spreadsheets, photographs, blueprints, floor
              plans, and artwork. This subseries contains the Marketing Department's archive of
              promotional material for individual productions for seasons 2003-2004 to 2016-2017,
              material detailing the creation of the IRT's new website in 2012, guidelines for IRT
              branding standards, and artwork used in the creation of promotional material. Material
              detailing the development of the capital campaign includes a brochure and statement
              regarding the campaign, photographs and videos used to promote the campaign, and
              photographs of the theatre before, during, and after the renovation.
This subseries is arranged alphabetically by production title, format, or topic.

This series documents various administrative offices and activities of the IRT,
            including the Producing Director, the General Manager, the Membership Manager, and the
            Marketing Department. Material in this series consists of both paper and born-digital
            material and includes correspondence, reports, budgets, photographs, and blueprints and
            floor plans.

This series is arranged in five subseries: Subseries III. A. General Administrative
            Records, Subseries III. B. Producing Director Records, Subseries III. C. General Manager
            Records, Subseries III. D. Membership Manager Records, and Subseries III.E. Marketing
            Department Records.
Material in box 42 is restricted.

unittitle.value: State of New York Department of Law
Series IV. Financial and Legal Records

p.value:
This series documents legal proceedings in which the IRT was involved, financial
            audits, and renovation of the IRT in 1995. This series consists of paper material and
            includes correspondence, contracts, court documents, audits, blueprints, and the IRT's
            by-laws and certificate of incorporation. Legal proceedings documented in this series
            include suits brought by the IRT against producer Robert Macken regarding his production
            of video recordings of  and  , and a suit brought
            by Charles Nelson Reilly against producer Michael Alden regarding  . The financial materials document
            the production of  and
            its 1997-1998 tour in New York City and Boston, Massachusetts; production budgets and
            box office totals for other IRT productions; and annual IRT audits. Material regarding
            the IRT's renovation include correspondence with the architect and blueprints detailing
            the renovation.

Two folders in this series are protected under the attorney work-product doctrine. They
            was separated from the collection in March 2018 pending a decision regarding its
            inclusion in the collection.
This series is arranged alphabetically by format or topic.

The Irish Repertory Theatre (IRT) Records document 28 seasons of productions staged by the
        Theatre, from 1988 to 2016. Productions include  ,  , and
           . The records document the work of various
        members and departments of the IRT, including Ciaran O'Reilly, the Producing Director; the
        Marketing Department; the General Manager; the Literary Department; and the Membership
        Manager. The records contain press and marketing materials, correspondence, scripts, legal
        documents, financial documents, original artwork, videos, and posters. The material consists
        of paper, born-digital, and audiovisual recordings. The press and marketing materials
        constitute the bulk of the collection and include programs, press releases, photographs,
        slides, and video recordings of productions and the IRT's annual benefits. The
        correspondence includes rejection letters; negotiations for rights, licensing, and
        productions; and communications with actors, producers, directors, and IRT members. The
        collection includes scripts used in productions and those submitted for the  . The legal documents include contracts as
        well as court documents from legal proceedings in which the IRT was involved. The financial
        records include season and production budgets, and box office receipts and statements. The
        original artwork includes paintings and drawings for set designs and posters.

The Irish Repertory Theatre (IRT) was founded in New York, New York in 1988 by Charlotte
        Moore and Ciarán O'Reilly. As of 2018, Moore is the Artistic Director and O'Reilly is the
        Managing Director. The two met in the late 1980s in a Hudson Guild Theater production of
        Hugh Leonard's  , and decided to collaborate on a
        production of Sean O'Casey's  in
        September 1988. Their profits from that production were enough to stage another show, and in
        this way the IRT was founded. The IRT produces Irish and Irish-American plays and musicals
        year-round, both classics of Irish theater as well as new works by emerging Irish and
        Irish-American writers. The Theatre moved to its current location, as of 2018, in the
        Chelsea neighborhood of Manhattan in 1995. The IRT, its staff, and their productions have
        garnered critical acclaim and industry awards for their work.

Materials are open without restrictions, with the exception of certain files pertaining to
        legal proceedings in Series IV.

Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the
        Irish Repertory Theatre, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York
        University in June 2016 by Ciarán O'Reilly. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in
        this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

New York University Libraries follows professional standards and best practices when
        imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity
        of the content.
Series IV. Financial and Legal Records, 1989-2010
